page.title: 01Area around Bevington -GLOS
page.content:
The area around Bevington in Gloucestershire consists mainly of rough pasture land, much of which lies less than 10m above sea level.
From the North East to South west runs a slight ridge upon which most of the settlements are based. This ridge rises to only 57m at it's highest point.
The largest single feature of this block is Whitcliff Park - a deer sanctuary belonging to Berkeley Castle just to the North of here. The park is not open to the public but can be visited with prior permission.
The other park indicated on the map is part of a private residence.
